intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius pallescens subsp. golesnicae, commonly known as the Golesnica hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets and is known for its slender, branching stems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
